description: TO AMEND THE RESOLUTION APPOINTING A COMMITTEE TO INVESTIGATE THE ORGANIZED EFFORTS OF CORPORATIONS TO CONTROL THE ELECTION OF MEMBERS OF CONGRESS, BY CONFINING INVESTIGATIONS TO STATE OF FLORIDA.

TO CONSIDER THE RESOLUTION PROVIDING THAT A SELECT COMMITTEE OF FIVE MEMBERS BE APPOINTED BY THE PRESIDENT OF THE SENATE TO INVESTIGATE THE SUBJECT OF ORGANIZED EFFORTS OF CORPORATIONS TO CONTROL THE ELECTION OF MEMBERS OF CONGRESS.

TO AMEND THE RESOLUTION APPOINTING A COMMITTEE TO INVESTIGATE THE SUBJECT OF ORGANIZED EFFORTS OF CORPORATIONS TO CONTROL THE ELECTION OF MEMBERS OF CONGRESS, BY HAVING SENATE REFER THE RESOLUTION TO THE COMMITTEE ON PRIVILEGES AND ELECTIONS IN PLACE OF  SELECT COMMITTEE OF FIVE MEMBERS APPOINTED BY THE PRESIDENT OF THE SENATE.

TO REFER TO THE COMMITTEE ON FINANCE, FOR FURTHER ACTION, THE RESOLUTION DIRECTING THAT COMMITTEE TO INQUIRE AND REPORT ON THE EXPEDIENCY OF THE FREE AND UNLIMITED COINAGE OF GOLD AND SILVER AT THE RATE OF ONE TO SIXTEEN; TO ISSUE, AS PREVIOUSLY, TREASUR NOTES, AND TO WITHDRAW THE POWER OF NATIONAL BANKS TO ISSUE CURRENCY.

TO REFER TO THE COMMITTEE ON MILITARY AFFAIRS, S. 1179 (29 STAT 84, 3/31/96), A BILL REPEALING SECTION 1218 OF THE REVISED STATUTES AS AMENDED OF CHAPTER 46 OF THE LAWS OF 1884, WHICH RELATES TO THE APPOINTMENT OF OFFICERS IN THE ARMY AND THE NAVY.
TO PASS THE RESOLUTIONS NAMING THE STANDING AND SELECT COMMITTEES OF THE SENATE FOR THE 54TH CONGRESS, COMMENCING JANUARY 1, 1896.

TO CONSIDER THE RESOLUTION THAT HEREAFTER NO BONDS OF THE UNITED STATES SHALL BE SOLD AT PRIVATE SALE OR UNDER PRIVATE CONTRACT, AND IN CASE OF ANY SALE OF BONDS UNDER EXISTING LAWS, THE SAME MUST BE MADE ONLY AFTER DUE ADVERTISEMENT OF SUCH SALE, AND THN ONLY TO HIGHEST BIDDER.

TO ADJOURN, MOTION MADE DURING DEBATE ON THE RESOLUTION RESTRICTING THE SALE OF U.S. BONDS AT PRIVATE SALE OR UNDER PRIVATE CONTRACT, AND IN CASE OF ANY SALE OF BONDS UNDER EXISTING LAW THE SAME SHALL BE MADE ONLY AFTER DUE ADVERTISEMENT OF SUCH SALE ANDTHEN ONLY TO HIGHEST BIDDER.
TO AMEND S. 1 (29 STAT 708, 2/8/96), A BILL GRANTING A PENSION TO THE WIDOW OF GENERAL WM. COGSWELL, BY REDUCING THE PENSION FROM $75 TO $50 PER MONTH.

TO PASS S. J. RES. 50 (1/28/1896), AUTHORIZING THE EMPLOYMENT OF A SKILLED ARCHITECT TO ASSIST THE SUPERVISING ARCHITECT OF THE TREASURY DEPARTMENT IN PREPARING THE DESIGN, PLANS, SPECIFICATIONS AND OTHER DRAWINGS FOR THE PUBLIC BUILDING AT CHICAGO, ILLIOIS.
TO CONSENT TO THE NOMINATION OF JOHN JOSEPH COPPINGER TO BE A BRIGADIER AS OF APRIL 25, 1895.
TO ADJOURN.

TO AMEND H. R. 2904, A BILL RELATING TO THE COIN REDEMPTION FUND, BY PROVIDING FOR THE REDEMPTION OF GREENBACKS, PRINCIPAL, AND INTEREST, TO BE PAID IN GOLD OR SILVER, AND THAT SAID NOTES, COMMONLY CALLED GREENBACKS, WHEN SO REDEEMED, SHALL BE RE-ISSUED,AS PROVIDED BY THE ACT OF MAY 31, 1878.
TO AMEND H. R. 2904, BY PROHIBITING THE SECRETARY OF THE TREASURY FROM ISSUING BONDS OR OTHER INTEREST HEARING OBLIGATIONS WITHOUT THE CONSENT OF CONGRESS.
TO TABLE THE AMENDMENT OF THE COMMITTEE ON FINANCE TO H. R. 2904.

TO AMEND THE AMENDMENT OF THE COMMITTEE ON FINANCE TO H. R. 2904, BY ADDING TO SECTION FOUR OF SAID AMENDMENT, A PROVISION THAT THE U.S. RETAIN THE SEIGNIORAGE UPON ALL COINAGE OF SILVER, EQUAL IN AMOUNT TO THE DIFFERENCE BETWEEN THE COINING VALUE AND TH COMMERCIAL VALUE OF SILVER BULLION WHEN PRESENTED AT THE MINT.

TO AMEND, IN THE NATURE OF A SUBSTITUTE, H. R. 2904, WHICH SUBSTITUTE PROVIDES THAT THE MINTS OF THE U.S. SHALL BE OPEN TO COINAGE OF SILVER, FOR WHICH CERTIFICATES SHALL BE ISSUED; THAT THE U.S. SHALL RETAIN THE SEIGNORAGE IN THE FORM OF SILVER DOLLARS;AND THAT THE ISSUANCE OF NATIONAL BANK NOTES FOR LESS THAN $10.00 DENOMINATIONS IS FORBIDDEN, AND THAT OUTSTANDING NOTES OF LOWER DENOMINATIONS SHALL BE REDEEMED BY ISSUING LARGER DENOMINATIONS IN THEIR STEED.

TO PASS H. R. 2904, AS AMENDED BY THE SUBSTITUTE WHICH PROVIDES THAT THE MINTS OF THE U.S. SHALL BE OPEN TO COINAGE OF SILVER, FOR WHICH CERTIFICATES SHALL BE ISSUED; THAT THE U.S. SHALL RETAIN THE SEIGNIORAGE IN THE FORM OF SILVER DOLLARS; THAT THE ISSUNCE OF NATIONAL BANK NOTES FOR LESS THAN $10.00 DENOMINATIONS IS FORBIDDEN, AND THAT OUTSTANDING NOTES OF LOWER DENOMINATIONS SHALL BE REDEEMED BY ISSUING LARGER DENOMINATIONS IN THEIR STEAD.
TO CONSIDER H. R. 4321 (29 STAT 17, 2/26/96), A BILL MAKING APPROPRIATIONS TO SUPPLY URGENT DEFICIENCIES IN THE APPROPRIATIONS FOR THE FISCAL YEAR ENDING JUNE 30, 1896.

TO CONSIDER THE RESOLUTION TO AMEND PARAGRAPH ONE OF SENATE RULE XVI, BY ELIMINATING THE PROVISION THAT ALL GENERAL APPROPRIATION BILLS BE REFERRED TO THE COMMITTEE ON APPROPRIATIONS, EXCEPT THOSE RELATING TO RIVERS AND HARBORS, WHICH ARE TO BE REFERRED O THE COMMITTEE ON COMMERCE; AND BY SUBSTITUTING THEREFORE, THE PROVISION THAT SAID BILLS BE REFERRED TO THE RESPECTIVE COMMITTEES INDICATED BY THEIR TITLE.
TO CONSENT TO THE NOMINATION OF GEORGE H. NEWMAN TO BE AN AGENT FOR THE INDIANS OF THE COLVILLE AGENCY IN WASHINGTON.
TO ADJOURN, MOTION MADE DURING DEBATE ON THE RESOLUTION TO AMEND RULE XVI.
TO ADJOURN, MADE DURING DEBATE ON THE RESOLUTION AMENDING RULE XVI.
TO TABLE THE RESOLUTION AMENDING RULE XVI.
TO REFER TO THE COMMITTEE ON RULES THE RESOLUTION AMENDING SENATE RULE XVI WITH INSTRUCTIONS TO TO REPORT THE SAME BACK TO THE SENATE ON FIRST MONDAY OF DECEMBER, WITH OR WITHOUT AMENDMENTS.

TO AMEND S. 176, A BILL PROVIDING FOR THE CONSTRUCTION OF A MEMORIAL BRIDGE ACROSS THE POTOMAC RIVER, BY ADDING A PROVISION THAT HALF OF THE COST FOR THE CONSTRUCTION OF THIS BRIDGE BE PAID BY THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA AND HALF BY THE UNITED STATES.
TO CONSIDER H. R. 2749, AN ACT TO PROVIDE AGAINST A DEFICIENCY BY TEMPORARILY INCREASING REVENUE TO MEET THE EXPENSES OF GOVERNMENT.

TO AMEND H. R. 4043 (29 STAT L. 46, 3/6/96), A BILL MAKING APPROPRIATIONS FOR THE SUPPORT OF THE MILITARY ACADEMY FOR FISCAL JUNE 30, 1897, BY HAVING CORPS OF CADETS APPOINTED BY THE PRESIDENT, CONSISTING OF TWO FROM EACH STATE AT LARGE, ONE FROM EACH COGRESSIONAL DISTRICT, ONE FROM EACH TERRITORY, ONE FROM THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA, AND TEN FROM THE U.S

TO TABLE THE AMENDMENT TO THE RESOLUTION, DIRECTING THE COMMITTEE ON FINANCE TO INVESTIGATE AND REPORT THE MATERIAL, FACTS, AND CIRCUMSTANCES CONNECTED WITH THE SALE OF U.S. BONDS BY THE SECRETARY OF THE TREASURY IN THE YEARS 1894 TO 1896, HOW PORCEEDS O SUCH BONDS WERE DISPOSED OF, AND TO WHAT PURPOSE; WHICH AMENDMENT, SUBSTITUTES, THAT A COMMITTEE OF FIVE SENATORS BE APPOINTED BY THE VICE PRESIDENT TO INVESTIGATE THE ABOVE CIRCUMSTANCES.
TO CONSIDER H. R. 2749, A BILL TEMPORARILY INCREASING REVENUE TO MEET THE EXPENSES OF THE GOVERNMENT AND PROVIDING AGAINST A DEFICIENCY.

TO TABLE THE AMENDMENT TO THE CONCURRENT RESOLUTION RELATING TO WAR IN CUBA, DECLARING THAT A STATE OF WAR EXISTS BETWEEN SPAIN AND CUBA, THAT THE U.S. SHOULD MAINTAIN STRICT NEUTRALITY AND ACCORD EACH BELLIGERENT EQUAL RIGHTS IN OUR PORTS AND TERRITORIE, AND THAT THE PRESIDENT OFFER TO THE SPANISH GOVERNMENT, RECOGNITION OF CUBAN INDEPENDENCE; WHICH AMENDMENT, SUBSTITUTES FOR THE ABOVE RESOLUTION, THE SENATE'S SOLICITUDE AND REGRETS IN THE SUFFERINGS AND DESTRUCTION IN THE CIVIL CONFLICT IN CUBA, AND SU...

TO TABLE THE AMENDMENT TO THE CONCURRENT RESOLUTION RELATING TO WAR IN CUBA, WHICH AMENDMENT, OFFERED AS A SUBSTITUTE, AUTHORIZES THE PRESIDENT TO ISSUE A PROCLAMATION RECOGNIZING THE REPUBLIC OF CUBA AS IT EXISTS UNDER THE CONSTITUTION AND FORM OF GOVERMENT PROCLAIMED AT JIMAGUAYA UNDER PRESIDENT CISENEROS, MAY 1895, AS A FREE AND INDEPENDENT NATION.
TO PASS THE CONCURRENT RESOLUTION, AS AMENDED, WHICH RELATES TO THE RECOGNITION OF THE STATE OF WAR EXISTING BETWEEN SPAIN AND CUBA.
TO CONSIDER EXECUTIVE BUSINESS.
TO ADJOURN.
TO CONSENT TO THE NOMINATION OF WILLIAM H. ANDERSON TO BE REGISTER OF THE LAND OFFICE AT ENID, OKLAHOMA TERRITORY.
TO CONSENT TO THE NOMINATION OF GEORGE H. NEWMAN TO BE AGENT FOR THE INDIANS OF THE COLVILLE AGENCY IN WASHINGTON.
THAT WHEN THE SENATE ADJOURNS TODAY IT DO SO UNTIL MONDAY NEXT.

TO AMEND H. R. 6248 (29 STAT L. 140, 5/28/96), A BILL APPROPRIATIONS FOR THE LEGISLATIVE, EXECUTIVE AND JUDICIAL EXPENSES OF THE GOVERNMENT FOR THE YEAR ENDING JUNE 30, 1897, AND FOR OTHER PURPOSES, ELIMINATING FROM THE BILL THAT SECTION RELATING TO THE ALARIES OF U.S
THAT WHEN SENATE ADJOURNS TODAY IT DO SO TO MEET ON MONDAY NEXT.

TO TABLE THE AMENDMENT TO H. R. 6248 (29 STAT 140, 5/28/96), AN ACT MAKING APPROPRIATIONS FOR THE LEGISLATIVE, EXECUTIVE, AND JUDICIAL EXPENSES OF THE GOVERNMENT FOR THE FISCAL YEAR ENDING JUNE 30, 1897, AND FOR OTHER PURPOSES; WHICH AMENDMENT PROPOSES TAT THE NEXT SESSION OF THE LIGISLATIVE ASSEMBLY OF THE TERRITORY OF NEW MEXICO SHALL COMMENCE ON THE FIRST MONDAY IN MAY 1897, AND THE SUCCEEDING SESSIONS SHALL COMMENCE ON THE SAME DATE OF EVERY ODD-NUMBERED YEAR THEREAFTER.
TO RECOMMIT S. 502 TO THE COMMITTEE ON PUBLIC LANDS, WITH INSTRUCTIONS TO APPROVE A COMPROMISE BETWEEN THE U.S. AND ARKANSAS.
TO RECOMMIT S. 502 TO THE COMMITTEE ON PUBLIC LANDS, WITH INSTRUCTIONS TO APPROVE A COMPROMISE BETWEEN THE U.S. AND ARKANSAS.
TO PASS S. 502, A BILL TO APPROVE A COMPROMISE BETWEEN THE U.S. AND ARKANSAS.

TO REFER TO THE COMMITTEE ON PUBLIC LANDS, THE RESOLUTION INQUIRING AS TO WHAT LEGISLATION MAY BE NECESSARY TO PREVENT THE PUBLIC LANDS FROM BEING APPROVED AND PATENTED WITHOUT A SURVEY AND EXAMINATION.

TO TABLE H. R. 6614 (29 STAT L. 313, 6/9/96), A BILL MAKING APPROPRIATIONS FOR THE SERVICE OF THE POST OFFICE DEPARTMENT, FOR THE FISCAL YEAR ENDING JUNE 30, 1897, IN ORDER TO END ACTION ON THE AMENDMENT AUTHORIZING THE SALARIES OF THE SUPERINTENDENT OR LERKS IN CHARGE OF STATIONS OR SUB-STATIONS, WHEN CONSOLIDATED WITH ANY OTHER POST OFFICE, TO BE PAID OUT OF POST OFFICE APPROPRIATIONS.

TO AMEND H. R. 6614, BY PROVIDING THAT NO STATION OR SUBSTATION BE ESTABLISHED OR MAINTAINED BEYOND THE BOUNDARIES OR CORPORATE LIMITS OF ANY CITY OR TOWN IN WHICH THE PRINCIPAL OFFICE, OF THE BRANCH IS LOCATED.
TO AMEND H. R. 6614 BY APPROPRIATING $50,000 TO BE USED BY THE POSTMASTER GENERAL TO DEFRAY EXPENSES OF EXPERIMENTS IN RURAL FREE DELIVERY.

TO AMEND H. R. 6614, BY APPROPRIATING AN ADDITIONAL COMPENSATION OF $80,000 TO BE PAID TO THE OCEANIC STEAMSHIP COMPANY FOR TRANSPORTING THE MAILS FROM SAN FRANCISCO TO NEW ZEALAND AND NEW SOUTH WALES VIA HONOLULU, AND THE MAILS DESTINED FOR THE AUSTRALIN COLONIES, NEW CALEDONIA, AND THE ISLANDS IN THE PACIFIC OCEAN, PROVIDED THAT THIS ADDITIONAL SUM, WITH THE SUM NOW PAID, SHALL NOT EXCEED $2.00 PER MILE, AS AUTHORIZED BY THE ACT OF MARCH 3, 1891.

TO AMEND H. R. 6614, BY ELIMINATING THE APPROPRIATION OF $196,614.22 TO BE EXPENDED BY THE POSTMASTER GENERAL FOR NECESSARY SPECIAL FACILITIES ON TRUNK LINES FROM BOSTON, BY WAY OF NEW YORK AND WASHINGTON, TO ATLANTA AND NEW ORLEANS AND TO PROVIDE THAT N PART OF THE APPROPRIATION MADE BY THIS PARAGRAPH, SHALL BE EXPENDED UNLESS THE POSTMASTER GENERAL SHALL DIEM SUCH EXPENDITURE NECESSARY IN ORDER TO PROMOTE THE INTEREST OF THE POSTAL SERVICE.

TO AMEND H. R. 6614, BY REDUCING THE APPROPRIATION FROM $196,614.20 TO $175,000, FOR CARRYING FACILITIES ON TRUCK LINES FROM BOSTON, MASSACHUSETTS BY WAY OF NEW YORK AND WASHINGTON, TO ATLANTA AND NEW ORLEANS.

TO RECEDE FROM THE SENATE AMENDMENT TO H. R. 6248 (29 STAT L. 140, 5/28/96), AN ACT MAKING APPROPRIATIONS FOR THE LEGISLATIVE, EXECUTIVE, AND JUDICIAL EXPENSES OF THE GOVERNMENT, FOR THE FISCAL YEAR ENDING JUNE 30, 1897, AND FOR OTHER PURPOSES, WHICH AMEDMENT AUTHORIZES THE SECRETARY OF THE INTERIOR TO EXTEND FOR ONE YEAR FROM JULY 1, 1896, THE PRESENT CONTRACT FOR PRODUCING COPIES OF DRAWINGS RELATING TO THE ISSUANCE OF PATENTS AND TRADEMARKS, AND PRODUCING EXHAUSTED COPIES AND COPIES OF PENDING APPLICA...

TO RECEDE FROM THE SENATE AMENDMENT TO H. R. 6248, WHICH AMENDMENT AUTHORIZES THE SECRETARY OF INTERIOR TO EXTEND FOR ONE YEAR FROM JULY 1, 1896, THE PRESENT CONTRACT FOR PRODUCING COPIES OF DRAWINGS RELATING TO THE ISSUANCE OF PATENTS TRADEMARKS, AND FO PRODUCING EXHAUSTED COPIES AND COPIES OF PENDING APPLICATIONS.

TO ADJOURN UNTIL MONDAY NEXT, MOTION MADE DURING DEBATE ON THE RESOLUTION WHICH PROVIDES FOR THE APPOINTMENT OF A SPECIAL COMMITTEE TO INVESTIGATE THE SALE OF BONDS BY THE SECRETARY OF TREASURY, AND REPORT THE FACTS AND CIRCUMSTANCES CONNECTED WITH SALESIN 1894, THROUGH 1896.

TO AMEND H. R. 6249 (29 STAT L. 321, 6/10/96), A BILL MAKING APPROPRIATIONS FOR CURRENT AND CONTINGENT EXPENSES OF THE INDIAN DEPARTMENT, AND FULFILLING TREATY STIPULATIONS WITH VARIOUS INDIAN TRIBES, FOR THE FISCAL YEAR ENDING JUNE 30, 1897, AND FOR OTHR PURPOSES, WHICH AMENDMENT ELIMINATES THE CLAUSE AUTHORIZING THE SECRETARY OF THE INTERIOR TO PAY PERSONS FOR LEGAL SERVICES RENDERED AND EXPENSES INCURRED UNDER CONTRACTS ENTERED INTO BY THE OLD SETTLERS AND THE WESTERN CHEROKEE INDIANS IN THE PROSECUTI...

TO AMEND H. R. 6249, BY PROHIBITING THE USE OF ANY MONEY APPROPRIATED BY THIS BILL FOR THE EDUCATION OF INDIAN CHILDREN IN SECTARIAN SCHOOLS, AUTHORIZING THE SECRETARY OF INTERIOR TO PROVIDE TEMPORARY SCHOOL ACCOMODATIONS FOR SUCH CHILDREN, DECLARING THA NO EDUCATION IN SECTARIAN SCHOOLS WILL BE FINANCED AS SOON AS THE SECRETARY CAN PROVIDE OTHERWISE (NOT LATER THAN JULY 1, 1898), AND AUTHORIZING THE SECRETARY TO MAKE CONTRACTS WITH PRESENT CONTRACT SCHOOLS FOR SUCH CHILDREN DURING 1897.
TO CONSIDER H. R. 886 (29 STAT L 195, 6/3/96), A BILL AMENDING SECTION 3255 OF THE REVISED STATUTES OF THE U.S., CONCERNING THE DISTILLING OF BRANDY FROM FRUITS.

TO AMEND H. R. 7542 (29 STAT L 361, 6/10/96), A BILL MAKING APPROPRIATIONS FOR THE NAVAL SERVICE, AND FOR OTHER PURPOSES FOR THE FISCAL YEAR ENDING JUNE 30, 1897, WHICH AMENDMENT FORBIDS THE PAYMENT OF ANY MONEY FROM THIS APPROPRIATION TO ANY OFFICER IN AVY OR MARINE CORPS WHO IS ON THE ACTIVE OR RETIRED LIST AND EMPLOYED BY A PERSON OR COMPANY FURNISHING NAVAL SUPPLIES OR WAR MATERIAL TO THE GOVERNMENT, REGARDING SUCH EMPLOYMENT UNLAWFUL AFTER JUNE 30, 1897.
TO AMEND THE NAVAL APPROPRIATION BILL BY REDUCING THE NUMBER OF BATTLESHIPS TO BE CONSTRUCTED FROM FOUR TO TWO.

TO AMEND THE NAVAL APPROPRIATION BILL BY ELIMINATING FROM THE BILL, THE APPROPRIATION OF $3,750,000, FOR THE CONSTRUCTION OF TWO SEA GOING BATTLESHIPS OF 11,000 TONS, SAID BATTLESHIPS TO HAVE THE HIGHEST PRACTICABLE SPEED FOR VESSELS OF THEIR CLASS.

TO AMEND THE NAVAL APPROPRIATION BILL, BY SUBSTITUTING AN APPROPRIATION FOR TORPEDO GUNBOATS AND TORPEDO DESTROYERS, TWENTY IN NUMBER, TO COST IN ALL, EXCLUSIVE OF ARMAMENT, AN AMOUNT NOT TO EXCEED $4,000,000, PROVIDED THAT NOT MORE THAN $375,000 SHALL B EXPENDED IN THE CONSTRUCTION OF ANY ONE OF SAID TORPEDO BOATS.
TO PASS THE AMENDMENT TO H. R. 7542, AS AMENDED BY PROVIDING THAT NOT MORE THAN $375,000 SHALL BE EXPENDED IN THE CONSTRUCTION OF THREE TORPEDO BOATS, INSTEAD OF ONE.
TO AMEND H. R. 7542, BY ELIMINATING FROM THE BILL THE WORDS "ONE THOUSAND" AND INSERTING "FIVE HUNDRED."

TO TABLE THE RESOLUTION, RELATING TO THE APPOINTMENT OF A SELECT COMMITTEE TO BE CHARGED WITH THE DUTY OF INVESTIGATING THE EFFORTS OF CORPORATIONS IN FLORIDA TO CONTROL THE ELECTION MEMBERS OF CONGRESS FROM THAT STATE, AND TO INFLUENCE LEGISLATION.

TO REFER TO THE COMMITTEE ON PRIVILEGES AND ELECTIONS, THE RESOLUTION RELATING TO THE APPOINTMENT OF A SELECT COMMITTEE TO BE CHARGED WITH THE DUTY OF INVESTIGATING THE EFFORTS OF CORPORATIONS IN FLORIDA TO CONTROL THE ELECTION OF MEMBERS OF CONGRESS FRO THAT STATE, AND TO INFLUENCE LEGISLATION.
TO RESUME CONSIDERATION OF THE RESOLUTION REPORTED FROM THE COMMITTEE ON PRIVILEGES AND ELECTIONS, DECLARING HENRY A. DU PONT TO BE ENTITLED TO A SEAT IN CONGRESS FROM DELAWARE.

TO CONSIDER H. R. 7977, THE RIVER AND HARBOR APPROPRIATION BILL, MADE DURING DEBATE ON THE RESOLUTION PROVIDING FOR THE APPOINTMENT OF A SPECIAL COMMITTEE TO INVESTIGATE THE CIRCUMSTANCES CONNECTED WITH THE SALE OF U.S. BONDS IN THE YEARS 1894, THROUGH 196.

TO REFER TO THE COMMITTEE ON PRIVILEGES AND ELECTIONS, THE RESOLUTION RELATING TO THE APPOINTMENT OF A SELECT COMMITTEE TO INVESTIGATE AND REPORT WHETHER THERE ARE INFLUENCES AFFECTING THE ELECTION OF MEMBERS OF CONGRESS IN THE STATE OF FLORIDA.

TO REFER TO THE COMMITTEE ON FINANCE, A RESOLUTION RELATING TO THE APPOINTMENT OF A SPECIAL COMMITTEE TO INVESTIGATE THE SALE OF BONDS BY THE SECRETARY OF TREASURY AND TO REPORT FACTS AND CIRCUMSTANCES CONNECTED WITH THE SALE IN THE YEARS 1894, THROUGH 196.

TO AMEND THE BOND SALE INVESTIGATION RESOLUTION, BY ELIMINATING THE PROVISION AUTHORIZING THE VICE PRESIDENT TO INVESTIGATE BOND SALES, AND BY SUBSTITUTING INSTEAD, THE AUTHORIZATION FOR THE COMMITTEE ON FINANCE TO INVESTIGATE SAME.

TO AMEND THE BOND SALE INVESTIGATION RESOLUTION, BY ELIMINATING THE CLAUSE REQUIRING THE COMMITTEE TO INVESTIGATE AND REPORT WHAT AMOUNT OF AVAILABLE FUNDS, CLASSIFIED, WAS IN THE U.S. TREASURY AND ON DEPOSIT IN OTHER PLACES, AT THE TIME THE BONDS WERE SLD; IF THERE WAS ENOUGH COIN ON HAND TO MEET ALL COIN OBLIGATIONS OF THE GOVERNMENT DUE AT TIME THE BONDS WERE SOLD; WHAT OBLIGATIONS WERE DUE, AND THE AMOUNT OF EACH; THE REASON FOR WITHDRAWAL OF COIN FROM THE TREASURY SHORTLY BEFORE THE BONDS WERE SOLD;...
TO PASS THE BOND SALE INVESTIGATION RESOLUTION, AS AMENDED.

TO TABLE THE AMENDMENT TO H. R. 7977, (29 STAT L 202, 6/3/96), A BILL MAKING APPROPRIATIONS FOR THE CONSTRUCTION, REPAIR, AND PRESERVATIONS OF CERTAIN WORKS ON RIVERS AND HARBORS, AND FOR OTHER PURPOSES, WHICH AMENDMENT ORDERED THE SECRETARY OF WAR TO APORTION CONTRACTS FOR THE CONSTRUCTION, REPAIR, AND PRESERVATION OF CERTAIN PUBLIC WORKS IN RIVERS AND HARBORS, SO AS NOT TO OBLIGATE THE GOVERNMENT FOR A SUM EXCEEDING $10,000,000 IN ANY ONE FISCAL YEAR, FOR MATERIALS AND WORK AUTHORIZED TO BE CONTRACTED ...

TO TABLE THE AMENDMENT TO H. R. 7977, WHICH AMENDMENT PROVIDES THAT THE SECRETARY OF WAR NOT OBLIGATE THE U.S. GOVERNMENT TO APPROPRIATIONS OF MORE THAN $10,000,000 IN ANY FISCAL YEAR, BY CONTRACTS FOR CERTAIN PUBLIC WORKS.
TO TABLE THE AMENDMENT TO H. R. 7977, WHICH AMENDMENT PROPOSES TO LIMIT THE EXPENDITURE BY THE SECRETARY OF WAR FOR CERTAIN PUBLIC WORKS TO TWENTY PER CENT OR LESS OF ALL APPROPRIATIONS.
TO PASS H. R. 7977.
TO AMEND THE RESOLUTION REGARDING THE SEATING OF HENRY A. DU PONT FROM DELAWARE, BY PROVIDING THAT HE IS NOT ENTITLED TO A SEAT IN THE SENATE FROM SAID STATE.
TO PASS THE RESOLUTION AS AMENDED, WHICH PROVIDES THAT HENRY A. DU PONT IS NOT ENTITLED TO A SEAT IN THE SENATE FROM THE STATE OF DELAWARE.

TO CONSIDER THE RESOLUTION CONCERNING THE APPOINTMENT OF A SELECT COMMITTEE TO MAKE AN INQUIRY AS TO WHETHER THERE IS, AND FOR THE LAST TWO AND ONE HALF YEARS, HAS BEEN, A REPUBLICAN FORM OF GOVERNMENT IN THE STATE OF ALABAMA.

TO RECONSIDER THE VOTE BY WHICH THE AMENDMENT TO H. R. 6994 (29 STAT 251, 6/6/96), A BILL RELATING TO THE SALE OF GAS IN THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA, WAS AGREED TO; BY BRINGING UP FOR FURTHER DISCUSSION, THE AMENDMENT SETTING FORTH A SCHEDULE OF RATES TO BEAPPLIED FOR THE SALE OF GAS.

TO PASS AN AMENDMENT TO H. R. 5210 (29 STAT L 393, 6/11/96), A BILL MAKING APPROPRIATIONS TO PROVIDE FOR THE EXPENSES OF THE GOVERNMENT OF THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA FOR THE FISCAL YEAR ENDING JUNE 30, 1897; WHICH AMENDMENT ELIMINATES THE DIRECT APPROPRIATON OF $94,700 FOR THE MAINTENANCE OF POOR AND DESTITUTE PERSONS IN PRIVATE INSTITUTIONS, AND FOR CHARITABLE AND REFORMATORY WORK IN THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA, AND INSERTING INSTEAD, DIRECT AND SPECIFIC PAYMENTS OUT OF SAID APPROPRIATION TO EACH INSTITUTION...

TO PASS AN AMENDMENT TO H. R. 5210 (29 STAT 393, 6/11/96), A BILL MAKING APPROPRIATIONS TO PROVIDE FOR EXPENSES OF THE GOVERNMENT OF THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA FOR THE FISCAL YEAR ENDING JUNE 30, 1897, WHICH AMENDMENT PROPOSES TO INSERT AN APPROPRIATION OF$112,500.00 OR AS MUCH AS IS NECESSARY THEREOF FOR THE PURCHASE OF ANALOSTAN ISLAND, IN THE POTOMAC RIVER, THE VALIDITY OF THE TITLE TO BE DETERMINED BY THE U.S

TO TABLE THE AMENDMENT TO H. R. 8109, (29 STAT L 256, 6/6/96), A BILL MAKING APPROPRIATIONS FOR FORTIFICATIONS AND OTHER WORKS OF DEFENSE, FOR THE ARMAMENT THEREOF, FOR THE PROCUREMENTS OF HEAVY ORDINANCE FOR TRIAL AND SERVICE, WHICH AMENDMENT PROPOSED T AUTHORIZE THE SECRETARY OF THE TREASURY TO ISSUE CERTIFICATES FOR AN AMOUNT NOT TO EXCEED $100,000,000, IF NECESSARY, FOR APPROPRIATIONS UNDER ANY ACT PASSED DURING THE PRESENT CONGRESS, APPROPRIATING MONEY TO BE PAID OUT OF THE TREASURY FROM THE FISCAL ...

TO AMEND H. R. 8109, WHICH AMENDMENT PROPOSES THAT ALL APPROPRIATIONS MADE IN THIS BILL SHALL BE PAYABLE IN TREASURY NOTES TO BE ISSUED BY THE SECRETARY OF THE TREASURY FROM TIME TO TIME AS SHALL BE REQUIRED.
TO AMEND H. R. 8109, BY INCLUDING IN THE GENERAL CLAUSE AFTER THE WORDS "EXPLOSIVES, TORPEDOES," SO AS TO SECURE FOR THAT DEVICE A PROPER EXAMINATION BY THE U.S. GOVERNMENT, AS TO ITS MERITS.

TO CONCUR IN THE REPORT OF THE COMMITTEE ON CONFERENCE ON H. R. 6248, (29 STAT L 140, 5/28/96), A BILL MAKING APPROPRIATIONS FOR THE LEGISLATIVE EXECUTIVE AND JUDICIAL EXPENSES OF THE GOVERNMENT, AND FOR OTHER PURPOSES, FOR THE FISCAL YEAR ENDING JUNE 30 1897.
TO ADJOURN, MOTION MADE DURING DEBATE ON S. 1341, A BILL PROHIBITING THE FURTHER ISSUANCE OF INTEREST-BEARING BONDS WITHOUT THE CONSENT OF CONGRESS.
TO CONSIDER EXECUTIVE BUSINESS, BY POSTPONING ACTION ON S. 1341.
TO GO INTO EXECUTIVE SESSION.
TO CONSIDER S. 1341.
TO CONTINUE CONSIDERATION S. 1341.
TO CONSIDER H. R. 8008 (29 STAT. 253, 6/6/96), A BILL DEFINING CHEESE, AND IMPOSING A TAX UPON AND REGULATING THE MANUFACTURE, SALE, IMPORTATION AND EXPORTATION OF FILLED CHEESE.

TO TABLE THE AMENDMENT TO H. R. 8008 WHICH AMENDMENT PROPOSES TO ADD A FIVE PER CENT REVENUE TAX ON ALL ARTICLES IN EXCESS OF $10,000 PER ANNUM, MANUFACTURED IN THE U.S. FROM IRON, STEEL, COPPER, NICKEL, BRASS, LEAD, ZINK, COTTON, WOOL, HEMP, SILK OR FLA.

TO TABLE AN AMENDMENT TO H. R. 8008, WHICH AMENDMENT PROPOSES TO PRESCRIBE A TAX OF $1.00 ON EVERY BARREL OF LAGER BEER, ALE AND PORTER, MANUFACTURED IN THE U.S., IN ADDITION TO TAX NOW IMPOSED THEREON.
TO TABLE AMENDMENT TO H. R. 8008, WHICH AMENDMENT PROPOSES TO LEVY A DUTY OF TEN CENTS PER POUND ON TEA AND ALL IMPORTS OF SAME.

TO AMEND H. R. 8293, (29 STAT L. 267, 6/8/96), A BILL MAKING APPROPRIATIONS TO SUPPLY DEFICIENCIES IN THE APPROPRIATIONS FOR FISCAL YEAR ENDING JUNE 30, 1896, AND FOR PRIOR YEARS, IN ORDER TO INCREASE THE AMOUNT OF THE AWARD ALLOWED TO POLK K. PENNINGTON FROM $500 TO $2,500, BECAUSE OF INJURIES RECEIVED BY HIM IN THE WRECK OF FORD THEATRE, AT WASHINGTON, D.C., JUNE 9, 1893.
